pr_title: HDDS-4155. Directory and filename can end up with same name in a path.

timeline.bodyText: @bharatviswa504 can you please reword this comment? I couldn't understand what it is saying.
timeline.author: arp7

timeline.bodyText: Does the directory name have a trailing / in RocksDB? If so, do we need to append it to keyname before calling checkDirectoryAlreadyExists?
timeline.author: arp7
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -158,6 +159,23 @@ public OMClientResponse validateAndUpdateCache(OzoneManager ozoneManager,
 
       validateBucketAndVolume(omMetadataManager, volumeName, bucketName);
 
+      // Check by the time we commit this file, is there any directory
+      // created if then fail it. This is being done for correctness.
+
+      // For now we are taking this approach similar to local file creation.
+      // TODO: In future this can be revisited to come up with an advanced
+      // approach.
+
+
+      if (ozoneManager.getEnableFileSystemPaths()) {
+        if (checkDirectoryAlreadyExists(volumeName, bucketName, keyName,

replies.bodyText:
Does the directory name have a trailing / in RocksDB?

Yes.

If so, do we need to append it to keyname before calling checkDirectoryAlreadyExists?

That is taken care of by the implementation of checkDirectoryAlreadyExists.
Where it uses getOzoneDirKey which appends "/"
replies.author: bharatviswa504

timeline.bodyText: Nice detailed explanation, thanks for adding this!
timeline.author: arp7

timeline.bodyText: Do we have a test case that tests the reverse scenario? i.e. create the dir first, then try to create a file with the same name. Also are we testing this via the object store interface with the flag enabled?
timeline.author: arp7

replies.bodyText:
Do we have a test case that tests the reverse scenario? i.e. create the dir first, then try to create a file with the same >name

No such test is currently available. Will post shortly this test also.

Also are we testing this via the object store interface with the flag enabled?

Yes test is with flag enabled.
replies.author: bharatviswa504

timeline.bodyText: Thanks for the additional test. Can we also add a test case that exercises the REST API to create a file and dir with the same name, in both orders?
timeline.author: arp7

replies.bodyText:
You mean use OzoneBucketAPI and create a Key or add a robot test using S3
If robot test, we don't have a test suite with this flag enabled,  there is already an open Jira for this, we can cover this additional scenario in that.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDDS-4154
replies.author: bharatviswa504

replies.bodyText: Added a test with object store API for the same scenario
replies.author: bharatviswa504

timeline.message:
HDDS-4155. Directory and filename can end up with same name in a path."
